job_description: Analyst, Data Governance - job post United Talent Agency (UTA) Los Angeles, CA $60,000 - $70,000 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $60,000 - $70,000 a year Job Type Full-time United Talent Agency is seeking a Data Governance Analyst who will work with a team of data professionals to ensure that the organization's data assets are managed efficiently and effectively. You will be responsible for supporting the implementation and maintenance of data governance policies, procedures, and standards. This includes monitoring data quality, providing data analysis and reporting, and facilitating data-related activities. The salary range for this role is $60,000 to $70,000 commensurate with experience and skills. What You Will Do Work with the data governance team to ensure compliance with data policies, procedures, and standards. Monitor data quality and report on data-related issues. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide solutions. Support data-related activities, including data modeling, data mapping, data lineage, and data profiling. Assist with the implementation and maintenance of data management tools. Participate in data governance meetings and provide input on data governance initiatives. Stay current with data governance trends, best practices, and industry standards. What You Will Need Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Management, or related field. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Knowledge of data governance principles and practices. Familiarity with data management tools such as data dictionaries, data lineage tools, and data profiling tools. Experience with, PowerBI, MYSQL, Tableau, Python, Microsoft Excel and Power Query. Understanding of APIs, Excel Macros, Web scraping, Query optimization, Database management, and Machine Learning Algorithms. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders from various departments. Strong attention to detail and accuracy. Passion for data, a strong work ethic, and a desire to learn and grow within the organization. What You Will Get The unique and exciting opportunity to work at one of the leading global entertainment companies Access to the tools, leadership, and resources you will need to create and drive a center of excellence The opportunity to do the best work of your career Work in an inclusive and diverse company culture Competitive benefits and programs to support your well-being Collaborative colleagues who are focused on making an impact About UTA UTA unites ideas, opportunities and talent. The company represents some of the world's most iconic, barrier-breaking artists, creators and changemakers—from actors, athletes and musicians to writers, gamers and digital influencers. One of the most influential companies in global entertainment, UTA's business spans talent representation, content production, as well as strategic advisory and marketing work with some of the world's biggest brands. Affiliated companies include Digital Brand Architects, KLUTCH Sports Group, Curtis Brown Group, and MediaLink. UTA is headquartered in Los Angeles with offices in Atlanta, Chicago, Nashville, New York and London. For more information: https://www.unitedtalent.com/about/ UTA and its Affiliated Companies are Equal Employment Opportunity employers and welcome all job seekers including individuals with disabilities and veterans with disabilities. #LI-CB1

Engineering Applications Software Engineer I - job post JPL/NASA 192 reviews 4800 Oak Grove Dr, Pasadena, CA 91109 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Job Details New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL. Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence. NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory continues to strive to push the boundaries for space exploration. This is in part to the outstanding team that gets assembled overcoming any challenges. The Planning and Execution Systems Section is looking for an Engineering Applications Software Engineer to be part of the Data Services group. This group focuses on server side and cloud connected software development to enable scheduling and commanding of Flight Missions and the Deep Space Network. Group members architect solutions ranging from collaborative web applications to scalable APIs. Group members research advanced technologies such as serverless or containerization to reduce deployment and administration overhead. Responsibilities You will work as a full stack web, Java, and relational database developer and lead continuous integration and development operations (devops) for the MGSS Planning, Sequencing and Analysis - Aerie development team. Aerie (https://github.com/NASA-AMMOS/aerie) is a vital application planned for use on the Europa Clipper and Mars Sample Return Lander missions. In this role you will own the build, testing and deployment process to help whole team see improved efficiency in taking feature development to production. As a developer you will focus on the spacecraft modeling and simulation framework to produce reliable predictions of expected behavior. Qualifications Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related technical discipline with typically a minimum of 1 years of related experience; Master’s degree in similar subject areas with a minimum of 0 year of related experience; or Ph.D. in similar fields General understanding and application of principles, theories, concepts and techniques in scientific and mathematical software design and implementation NodeJS development TypeScript development Significant experience with an object oriented language: C++, Python, Java, C Experience using a modern web framework such as Angular, React, Svelte or Vue Team first engineer capable of excelling in a high functioning team of 8 - 12 engineers Desired Qualifications: Demonstrated excellent communication (both oral and written) with ability to present technical results to a wide audience Automated testing experience: Mocha, Karma, Jasmin, or similar. Experience with cloud applications. Familiarity with Linux/Unix development environment Ability to apply engineering and science principles to generate the solution to a variety of complex problems Highly energized, self-motivated, organized, detail oriented, with the ability to work on assignments that are complex in nature using considerable practical judgment and making recommendations Knowledge in space mission design, analysis, and operations JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date. For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks The hiring range displayed below is specifically for those who will work in or reside in the location listed. In extending an offer, Jet Propulsion Laboratory considers factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s job related skills, experience, knowledge, and relevant education/training. Hiring range for this job may be adjusted based on primary work location outside of Pasadena, California. This adjusted range will be provided to candidates by the Recruiter when applicable. The typical full time equivalent annual hiring range for this job in Pasadena, California. $81,224 - $96,616 JPL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy or perceived pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status or any other characteristic or condition protected by Federal, state or local law. In addition, JPL is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor. EEO is the Law. EEO is the Law Supplement Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision The Jet Propulsion Laboratory is a federal facility. Due to rules imposed by NASA, JPL will not accept applications from citizens of designated countries or those born in a designated country unless they are Legal Permanent Residents of the U.S or have other protected status under 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3). The Designated Countries List is available here.

TYPICAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Work with Sales, Customer Service, distributors, architects, and building owners to develop product specifications and forecasts for new product development. Chair and/or serve on Task Force teams. This will include product redesigns and/or new product development. Prepare strategic (competitive) impact, and financial analysis (e.g. NPV, ROI, IRR) of projects. Troubleshoot problem areas of a new product introduction or product change. Communicate and coordinate actions with Sales, Customer Service, Manufacturing, Engineering, Purchasing, Cost Accounting, Bobrick divisions and work with vendors, outside consultants (e.g. industrial design, market research, and advertising agency) to insure smooth implementations. Develop timelines and budgets for projects. Monitor and coordinate progress to insure projects stay on schedule. Assist in production of advertising program projects including catalogs, advertising, price lists, trade shows, representative samples. Spend time in the field with building owners, distributors, architects, contractors, sales representatives Work with Excel and/or other database sources to provide detailed analysis for the Marketing department. Examples of this may include forecasting information to provide to Supply Chain, pricing and profitability analysis, and assistance performing analysis for Quarterly Business Review meetings and Monthly Business Unit performance report. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree required. Ability to work with data, interpret, analyze and present data. Communicate clearly and persuasively both orally and in written forms. Is adaptable to change and is able to work under pressure and accept constantly changing priorities. Proficient in Microsoft Office software programs, with a high degree of skill in Excel. Statistician, Advisor [HYBRID] - job post 193,900 950 reviews Rosemead, CA 91771 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Job Description Join the Clean Energy Revolution Southern California Edison is looking for that special breed of Data professional that is hard to find but actually does exist. Become a Compliance Statistician Advisor at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. In this job, you’ll be part data wrangler, part mathematician, part coder, and part solver of sophisticated problems. Are you curious and use creativity to ask the right questions? Compliance Statisticians know how to use data analysis to tackle difficult business problems. You can make a difference in the world as a Compliance Statistician Advisor . Your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions and create cleaner air for everyone. Are you ready to take on the challenge to help us build the future? We want you to use your unique gifts to help one of the largest energy companies in the country create a next generation a compliance metrics and analytics program. A day in the life - Get ready to think big, work smart and shine bright! We want to use data and advanced analytics to design new methods, approaches and procedures to set and evaluate SCE's compliance health. This role will be responsible for working closely with clients, information architects, data engineers, and compliance professionals to turn data into critical information and insights that can be used to make sound business decisions. By applying advanced analytics, this role will build statistical and mathematical models to support understanding of key drivers impacting Ethics and Compliance. Responsibilities include: Analyze large data sets impacting ethics and/or compliance and extracting relevant insights from them through use of statistical software and programming languages. Facilitate selection and preparation of data to be used for specific use cases by identifying what data is available and relevant to compliance. Design and develop statistical models that are used to analyze data and make predictions. Conduct research to understand complex problems and to identify new statistical techniques and methods. Collaborate with operational analytic teams across the company on data analytics techniques and tools to improve compliance analytics capabilities at SCE. Advice OU compliance professionals and senior leaders of trends and analysis of compliance data to support data driven decisions to reduce compliance risk. Qualifications The essentials Seven or more years of experience using data analytics to interpret and make recommendations based on findings Two or more years of experience in data mining, predictive modeling, machine learning, or statistical modeling. Proficiency in some combination of SQL, R, Python, SAS, Power BI, Excel VBA. Experience in extracting and transforming large datasets. The preferred Bachelor or Graduate Degree in any STEM curriculum or in quantitative subject area (i.e., statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, business analytics or informatics) Certification in statistics, data science, or predictive analytics subject area Experience analyzing complex data and identifying patterns, trends, and anomalies. Experience building business intelligence tools and visualization solutions. Three or more years of experience communicating with broad range of stakeholders Strong story telling skills and ability to demonstrate analytical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. Highly adaptable and flexible with demonstrated experience keeping up new trends and innovations in the advanced analytics space Strong ability to think creatively and develop innovative analytical solutions to ethics and compliance challenges. Experience mentoring junior team members and experience working effectively with other departments and stakeholders to achieve business objectives You should know This position’s work mode is hybrid. The employee will report to an SCE facility for a set number of days with the option to work remotely on the remaining days. Unless otherwise noted, employees are required to reside in the state of California. Further details of this work mode will be discussed at the interview stage. Visit our Candidate Resource page to get meaningful information related to benefits, perks, resources, testing information, hiring process, and more! Relocation does not apply to this position. This position requires testing and applicants who are identified to continue through the selection process will be invited to test via email. Reference our Information Guides for the following test: Edison Individual Contributor Workstyles (Test #8203). Candidates who have previously passed these assessment(s), in some cases, may not need to retest again for this position. About Southern California Edison The people at SCE don't just keep the lights on. Our mission is so much bigger. We’re fueling the kind of innovation that’s changing an entire industry, and quite possibly the planet. Join us and create a future with cleaner energy, while providing our customers with the safety and reliability they demand. At SCE, you’ll have a chance to grow personally and professionally, making a real impact in Southern California and around the world. At SCE, we celebrate our differences. We are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status. Please contact us to request accommodations at (833) 343-0727.

Staff Software Engineer - job post LinQuest Corporation 51 reviews El Segundo, CA 90245 $80,000 - $100,000 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $80,000 - $100,000 a year Job Type Full-time LinQuest is seeking an entry-level Software Engineer to join our team in any of the following locations: El Segundo, CA. LinQuest is the prime contractor on the MSEIT contract. By applying to this position, you are in consideration for LinQuest employment. However, you also have the option to be hired by one of our subcontractor teammates. You will join a Software Development team defining, designing and implementing the next generation of space communication systems supporting the United States Space Force’s satellite communications (SATCOM). You will support Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) activities in a multidisciplinary and collaborative environment. The Software Engineer will interface and collaborate with SE&I team members, contractors, government civilians and members of the USSF. This entry-level role may allow for a rotation program that enables broad exposure to multiple aspects of software development activities, including: emulators, test systems, algorithm implementation, and DevOps development. The MILSATCOM Systems Engineering, Integration, and Test (MSEIT) effort provides leading edge Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) for the Space Force’s Space Systems Command (SSC). We support the Space Force’s acquisition of state-of-the-art satellite communications systems, providing global secure, survivable, and protected communications for our nation’s warfighters. We seek technical individuals who will thrive in a highly collaborative work environment of small teams, using the most modern tools and methodologies to tackle the challenges of integrating complex space and ground communications systems. Responsibilities: Implement software in a language such as Java, C, or Python Deliver production code at a regular cadence using Agile techniques, tools, and methodologies Collaborate with Software Architects, Software Engineers, Cyber Security experts, and Data Scientists to develop artifacts Required Experience: BS in technical field, such as engineering and computer science Demonstrable understanding of software architecture and algorithm implementation and tradeoffs Strong interpersonal skills, communication (oral and written), and presentation skills Proficient in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Powerpoint) 6 months or more experience in software development, to include internships and academic projects US Citizenship and the ability to obtain a Secret clearance are required for the position Preferred Experience: 1+ year of professional or internship experience in software development (writing, debugging, integrating, and testing) Familiarity with agile development Familiarity with Jira and Confluence Familiarity with cloud architecture systems Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases Secret clearance Compensation: Starting salary ranges from $80,000 to $100,000 depending on relevant experience and qualifications. Benefits: LinQuest offers comprehensive and competitive benefit offerings to our team members to include medical, dental, vision, retirement, paid time off, company paid life insurance, and more! For additional information please visit: https://www.linquest.com/careers/our-benefits COVID-19 Compliance Guidelines As a federal contractor, all LinQuest team members must comply with Executive Order 14042- Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, which includes mandatory vaccination and ability to provide proof of vaccination status prior to start of employment. Additionally, team members are expected to comply with all safety protocols related to mask wearing and physical distancing while in covered contractor workplaces. Bioinformatics Software Quality Assurance Engineer - job post Fulgent Therapeutics Llc 4399 Santa Anita Ave, El Monte, CA 91731 $65,000 - $74,000 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $65,000 - $74,000 a year Job Type Full-time Fulgent is a leader in genetic and genomic clinical testing, a publicly traded company located in Los Angeles, California. We are a technology-driven company with extensive academic/clinical experience and capabilities in Next Generation Sequencing and bioinformatics. This distinction has advanced us to the forefront of the rapidly advancing genetic and genomic testing industry. Fulgent's unique chemistries and superior proprietary bioinformatics pipeline has propelled our explosive growth in recent years. We offer the most expansive set of clinical genetic tests in the world, including 22,000+ single gene tests, 900+ preset panels, rearrangement testing, clinical exome/trios, whole exome/trios, whole genome and our All-in-One reflex test. We are a CLIA and CAP accredited laboratory. Fulgent has state-of-the-art clinical, sequencing and bioinformatics tools, including the latest Illumina sequencers such as the NovaSeq. SUMMARY OF POSITION: The Bioinformatics Software Quality Assurance (SQA) Engineer will ensure that internal software changes are properly defined and tested to guarantee that accurate genomic testing results are presented for analysis and reporting. This position will track the modifications that are scheduled for the next software release, help define the areas that will be affected by those modifications, and use automated test programs to evaluate the impact of the modifications. Additionally, this position will go through a functionality checklist to ensure that the end-user will not experience any unforeseen issues as a consequence of the modifications. The SQA Engineer will identify and document in a bug tracking system any issues encountered during either the automated or manual testing. This position will help maintain a list of available and desired automated tests, and will make sure that the set of data used for the automated tests is up to date. KEY JOB ELEMENTS: Work with software engineers to track scheduled software updates and the scope of their potential impact. Determine which tests need to be run prior to signing off on the software updates. Evaluate results of automated tests, resolving any differences from predicted outcomes. Manually step through checklist to ensure GUI behaves as expected. Log any unresolved issues in bug tracking database. Define additional automated tests that should be performed. Refine GUI checklist so that it can efficiently identify any critical functions that are not working properly. Maintain input set of data and expected output results for automated testing. Work with curation scientists and other end users to identify enhancements that would further improve quality assurance. KNOWLEDGE / EXPERIENCE: BS degree in computer science, bioinformatics, or a related field. 1-2 years of experience in software development or quality assurance. Understanding of software quality assurance methodologies, tools, and processes. Strong experience with issue tracker software (e.g. JIRA, Bugzilla). Ability to troubleshoot both individually and as part of a team. Good oral and written skills with the ability to communicate in an open, transparent, timely and consistent manner. Must enjoy working in a multi-disciplinary and collaborative environment. Exposure to Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) data is a plus. Experience with SQL, JavaScript, Python, Bash, Java, and/or Scala is a plus. Experience with automated build systems and/or continuous integration tools (e.g. Jenkins, Atlassian Bamboo) is a plus. SUPERVISOR RESPONSIBILITIES: None REPORTS TO: Principal Architect, PLM Team ENVIRONMENT: Fulgent Therapeutics LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The term “qualified individual with a disability” means an individual with a disability who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of the position. Safety and Work Environment: General office environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Maintains a clean, neat, and orderly work area. Adheres to Department Specific Safety Guidelines. Physical Demands: Standing, sitting, walking, bending, reaching, manual manipulation, and lifting up to 10 pounds.
